page.title: 02Old Costessey
page.content:
The original village is now called Old Costessey, as a lot of the land between Old Costessey and the A47 (Norwich to King's Lynn) road is now the most westerly suburb of Norwich, called New Costessey.
Costessey Hall, now a ruin surrounded by a private golf club, was the seat of Lord Stafford, whose family name was Jerningham.
Another local family was the Gurney family, a famous Quaker family who lived at Earlham Hall. Gurney's Bank was one of the predecessors of Barclay's Bank, in Norwich. Elizabeth Gurney married Joseph Fry, and became a great prison reformer.
